#summary The body align attribute specifies the horizontal alignment of the element within its bounding box.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [BodyElement <body> element] > *align attribute*

== Usage ==

{{{
<body align="center">
<p>I am trapped in a chocolate factory.
Do not send help.</p>
</body>
}}}

The `align` attribute is deprecated in favor of the [TextAlignCSSProperty text-align CSS property], but browsers still support it.

== Values ==

  * `left` (default)
  * `center`
  * `right`

== Elements ==

You can use the `align` attribute on the following elements:

  * [AddressElement <address>]
  * [AppletElement <applet>]
  * [BlockquoteElement <blockquote>]
  * [BodyElement <body>]
  * [CaptionElement <caption>]
  * [CenterElement <center>]
  * [ColElement <col>]
  * [ColgroupElement <colgroup>]
  * [DdElement <dd>]

  * [DivElement <div>]
  * [DlElement <dl>]
  * [DtElement <dt>]
  * [EmbedElement <embed>]
  * [FieldsetElement <fieldset>]

  * [HrElement <hr>]
  * [IframeElement <iframe>]
  * [ImgElement <img>]
